title: Elongated triangular gyrobicupola
summary: In geometry, the elongated triangular gyrobicupola is one of the Johnson solids  (J36). As the name suggests, it can be constructed by elongating a "triangular gyrobicupola," or cuboctahedron, by inserting a hexagonal prism between its two halves, which are congruent triangular cupolae (J3). Rotating one of the cupolae through 60 degrees before the elongation yields the triangular orthobicupola (J35).
